Donald Rumsfeld takes particular offense at Colin Powell 's contention that he was misled by faulty intelligence into making the public case for the invasion of Iraq. Colin Powell was not duped or misled by anybody, Donald Rumsfeld writes. "Nor did he lie about Saddam Hussein 's suspected WMD stockpiles. The president did not lie. months tells NRO the conservative Hoosier "was extremely torn while he deliberated." Another who met with Mike Pence feels his heart was never completely in a bid for president. Someone close to Mike Pence explains that the people closest to him, the friends and people he knew best from Indiana, wanted to see him come back to Indiana. By contrast, "the support for him to run nationally was in large part from leaders of the national conservative movement"- who perhaps didn't have the same sway as his longtime supporters. Eric Schmidt 's departure had been a long time coming, says Charles Arthur in The Guardian: After slipups with search, Street View and Android, it's clear that Google needs tighter control at the top- and Eric Schmidt is not the man for the job. What of Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin ? He is said to be focusing on strategic projects and is particularly interested in social networking.
